alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 1:25PM PST until December 16 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 1500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up 2 to 4 inches with 4 to 8 inches above 3000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph in exposed areas. * WHERE...Higher terrain of Eastern Curry County and Josephine County including Hayes Hill on Highway 199 and Sexton Pass on Interstate 5. This also includes the hills around the Illinois, Applegate and lower Rogue Valleys as well as areas near O`Brien. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will likely fluctuate between 1500 feet and 2000 feet through the Advisory period. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
